# Goast OKR Definitions (Q1-Q3 2026)

## OKR 1: Users can start the conversations they need
- KR 1.1: Conversation assembly rate (invite acceptance rate)
- KR 1.2: Time to conversation start (creation to first message)
- KR 1.3: Viable conversation rate (3+ members within 24 hours)
- KR 1.4: Stillborn conversation rate (dissolutions within 1 day with <3 members)

## OKR 2: Conversations move to real outcomes
- KR 2.1: Active participation rate (daily active users who send messages)
- KR 2.2: Messages per active user (depth of conversation)
- KR 2.3: Decision velocity (proposal resolution time)
- KR 2.4: Quorum success rate (proposals with enough participation)
- KR 2.5: Reaction density (reactions per message)

## OKR 3: Conversations complete successfully
- KR 3.1: Healthy completion rate (dissolutions with 2+ days lifespan and 3+ members)
- KR 3.2: Median conversation lifespan (target 3-7 days)
- KR 3.3: Premature death rate (dissolutions <1 day or <5 messages)
- KR 3.4: Proposal completion before dissolution (resolved proposals before end)

## OKR 4: Users return for new conversations
- KR 4.1: Multi-conversation user rate (2+ conversations per month)
- KR 4.2: Return after completion (D7/D28 return after successful dissolution)
- KR 4.3: Conversations per active user (monthly frequency)
- KR 4.4: New conversation creation rate (monthly active users who create)
